meanings.definition: Opposed to or against commercial activities or interests.
meanings.sent1: The artist's anticommercial stance led them to reject any sponsorship deals.
meanings.sent2: The anticommercial message of the protest resonated with many people.
meanings.sent3: It was quite anticommercial of the small bookstore to refuse to sell popular bestsellers.
meanings.sent4: Her anticommercial attitude was like a breath of fresh air in the corporate world.
meanings.sent5: The anticommercial movement gained momentum among independent filmmakers.

meanings.definition: Not conforming to or suitable for commercial purposes.
meanings.sent1: The experimental film was too anticommercial to attract a mainstream audience.
meanings.sent2: The anticommercial design of the building puzzled many architects.
meanings.sent3: The anticommercial product failed to sell well in the market.
meanings.sent4: His anticommercial approach to fashion design challenged industry norms.
meanings.sent5: The anticommercial nature of the art installation sparked heated debates among critics.
